newsitem.title: USA: Intel shares said up on rising estimates.
newsitem.headline: Intel shares said up on rising estimates.

text.p: Intel Corp shares closed up 5-1/2 to 105-3/8 amid speculation that the world's biggest chip maker will report better-than-expected earnings on Monday.
The stock was the third most active in U.S. markets on trading of 11.1 million shares.
No on at Intel could be reached for comment.

The company is scheduled to report its earnings after the close of the market on Monday. Wall Street analysts expect Intel to earn $1.25 a share, according to a recent survey by First Call. In recent days, however, some analysts have said Intel could easily surpass that.

"Business is extremely good," said Mark Edelstone, an analyst at Prudential Securities Research in San Francisco. Intel's gross margins -- the amount of money left over from revenues when cost of goods are subtracted -- clearly improved in the third quarter, which should boost earnings beyond the strong sales, Edelstone said.
John Marren, an analyst at Morgan Stanley raised his rating on Intel to "strong buy" from "outperform" on Friday.
"We are confident in Intel's ability to meet or exceed our new EPS estimate of $1.31," Marren wrote in a research report released today. He wasn't immediately available for comment.
Marren also expects two new line of microprocessors, the central computing chip in a PC, to "provide the stimulus for a year of tremendous growth."
Intel's stock could reach $130 in the next 12 month, Marren said.
"People know that the business is turning up, personal computer sales are rising," said Tom Kurlak, an analyst at Merrill Lynch in New York. "People want to be in this stock group."
